weary.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: very tired or bored, especially because you have been doing something for a long time
weary.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She found Rachel in the kitchen, looking old and weary.
She sat down with a weary sigh.
He was weary of the constant battle between them.
weary.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually say tired rather than weary:
They were tired after their journey.
weary.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to become very tired, or make someone very tired
weary.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Amanda wouldnâ€™t admit how much the children wearied her.
As the day wore on, we wearied of the journey.
